pullrequest.title: Configure internalClusterTest for snapshot_feature_enabled flag
Fix NPE when building exception messages
pullrequest.body: resolves #59103 This pushes generating the description string for the values source into the values source config, and does better handling of the various cases of where the config got the values from.

pullrequest.title: Remove minimumRuntime sourceSet from build-tools
[Doc] migration guide joda
Run 180_locale_dependent_mapping only since 6.8.5
Avoid precision loss in DocValueFormat.RAW#parseLong
[ML][Analytics] fix bug where regression deleted early does not delete state
sync before trimUnreferencedReaders to improve index preformance
pullrequest.body: close #46201 and see more discussion in #46203 ![65770379-8c683a00-e168-11e9-836f-1f87d6c10f5c](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18375623/66480643-bb1fd200-ead1-11e9-81ac-84e53e094850.png)

pullrequest.title: Add link to upgrading clusters to ccr
pullrequest.body: fixes #47218. I added a link to the upgrading clusters page in the overview page. <!-- Thank you for your interest in and contributing to Elasticsearch! There are a few simple things to check before submitting your pull request that can help with the review process. You should delete these items from your submission, but they are here to help bring them to your attention. --> - Have you signed the [contributor license agreement](https://www.elastic.co/contributor-agreement)? - Have you followed the [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)? - If submitting code, have you built your formula locally prior to submission with `gradle check`? - If submitting code, is your pull request against master? Unless there is a good reason otherwise, we prefer pull requests against master and will backport as needed. - If submitting code, have you checked that your submission is for an [OS and architecture that we support](https://www.elastic.co/support/matrix#show_os)? - If you are submitting this code for a class then read our [policy](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributing-as-part-of-a-class) for that.

There are a few simple things to check before submitting your pull request that can help with the review process. You should delete these items from your submission, but they are here to help bring them to your attention. --> - Have you signed the [contributor license agreement](https://www.elastic.co/contributor-agreement)? yes - Have you followed the [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)? yes - If submitting code, have you built your formula locally prior to submission with `gradle check`? - If submitting code, is your pull request against master? Unless there is a good reason otherwise, we prefer pull requests against master and will backport as needed.

pullrequest.title: Docs: Clarify password protection support with keystore
Correct docs for binary fields and their default for doc values
Docs: Add note about removal of path_style_access in s3 repository
Build: Remove norelease from forbidden patterns
Docs: Add note about file scripts removal

Plugins: Make remove command resilient to missing plugin name
S3 Repository: Remove bucket auto create
Update Jackson to 2.8.6
support numeric bounds with decimal parts for long/integer/short/byte datatypes
Remove generics from ActionRequest
Remove support for sorting terms aggregation by ascending count
Cli: Add verbose output with zip url when installing plugin
Add created flag to IndexingOperationListener#postIndex
Add created flag to IndexingOperationListener#postIndex
Fix plugins integration tests on Windows
Remove multicast plugin
[Ingest] Introduce DeDot Processor
TransportClient: Add exception when using plugin.types, to help migration to addPlugin
Fix OOM in AbstractXContentParser
changing REST integration test command line.
[Ingest] [WIP] Introduce ConditionalProcessor
Fix Delete-by-Query with Shield
fixing run.bat and run.sh
pullrequest.body: fixed #14423 I'm a little new to gradle, so do double check I haven't missed something basic.

pullrequest.title: Adding a link to the guide from the docs.
pullrequest.body: fixed #14257 The guide has nice examples of the json responses to the bulk api.

pullrequest.title: Build: Add back manifest info to jars
cloud-gce plugin should check `discovery.type`
pullrequest.body: closes #13614 This commmit adds check `discovery.type` and other required parameters before loading gce plugin. This change make gce plugin behave like Azure: if user doesn't set discovery type to `gce`, ES would not load gce modules. if user does set discovery type to `gce` but without all parameters we need, es would fail to start.

pullrequest.title: Remove the experimental indices.fielddata.cache.expire
The queue_size value should be shown as an integer.
GeoDistance Aggregation now prints field name when it finds an unexpected token.
Clarify docs for transpositions setting in completion suggester
Custom analyzer names and aliases must not start with _
Fix add node name to _cat/recovery
Make GeoContext mapping idempotent
Make `routing_nodes` an independent metric option in cluster state api
Mappings: Remove ability to set path for _id and _routing on 2.0+ indexes
pullrequest.body: closes #6730 Note: I would like to keep the BulkTests checking pre-parsing when path is set works, but I don't see a way without moving that to the static backcompat tests. It would be nice if we could fake out the index settings (ie set the index_created_version) but I don't think that is possible...

pullrequest.title: Raise an exception on an array of values being sent as the factor for a `field_value_factor` query
Make _score in groovy scripts comparable
FunctionScore: RandomScoreFunction now accepts long, as well a strings.
Improve rolling upgrade doc
add params properly when using wildcard
NPE in ShardStats when routing entry is not set yet on IndexShard
More lenient type parsing in histo/cardinality aggs
Remove (mostly) unused 'failure' member from ShardSearchFailure.
Throw exception if function in function score query is null
Support empty properties array in mappings
Provide meaningful error message if field has no fielddata type
Add lucene LMSimilarity
Fix geo_point accepting null values
Check "store" parameter for binary mapper and check "index_name" for all mappers
pullrequest.body: closes #5474 the "index_name" is also ignored without throw exception, added check for that as well

pullrequest.title: Fix dynamic_type in dynamic_template
Add suggest stats
Add human readable `start_time` and `refresh_interval`
Add caching support to Geohash Cell Filter
pullrequest.body: closes #5462 a few things not sure: - currently it's hard code to cache if the `precision` is larger than `1000km`, should we add a config for this? - Should we separate the builder and parser to 2 files to be consistent with other filter builder/parser? - the `GeohashCellFilter.create()` is only used in this class and only in the parser, should we move that to the parser

pullrequest.title: merge GeoPoint specific mapping properties
pullrequest.body: closes #5505 I assume only `validate_lat` and `validate_lon` can be updated, other fields will throw exceptions. Please let me know if I was wrong. Also added `precision_step` to the document page

pullrequest.title: Merge `null_value` for boolean field and remove `include_in_all` for boolean field in doc
Add failures reason to delete by query response
pullrequest.body: closes #5093 It will return an array of failures. e.g. ``` json "tweet-36": { "_shards": { "total": 5, "successful": 4, "failed": 1, "failures": [ { "index": "tweet-36", "reason": "EsRejectedExecutionException[rejected execution (queue capacity 200) on org.elasticsearch.action.support.replication.TransportShardReplicationOperationAction$AsyncShardOperationAction$1@176685ee]" } ] } } ```

pullrequest.title: Handle "true"/"false" in snapshot api for "include_global_state"
pullrequest.body: closes #4949 : bug fix : handle "true"/"false" in snapshot api for "include_global_state" [see issue #4949](https://github.com/elasticsearch/elasticsearch/issues/4949)

pullrequest.title: closes #4949 : bug fix : handle "true"/"false" in snapshot api for "include_global_state"

rename _shard -> _index and also rename classes and variables

throw exception if decay is requested for a field with multiple values
